content: Has it been considered to have support for box drawing characters for error messages? It would make error messages just :sparkles: that much prettier :sparkles:. It could be either opt-in via an environment variable or auto-detected (if the terminal supports non-ASCII characters).
I asked ekuber same thing recently. https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/37703#issuecomment-260122290 is what I got in response
I have seen some fancy characters be a bit wider than a single ascii character in several terminals. This may be a font thing, but it mangles things pretty badly IMHO.

TIL there's an RFC that says what error messages should look like. Even if it is opt-in via an environment variable I think it'd be worth it. Then the issue is entirely on the user if something doesn't work quite right.
It looks like that part of the RFC is a goal, though, not a strict requirement.
